meanings.definition: Using or expressed in more words than are needed.
meanings.sent1: Her verbose explanation made the topic harder to understand.
meanings.sent2: The verbose report contained unnecessary details.
meanings.sent3: The verbose cat meowed endlessly, trying to get attention.
meanings.sent4: His verbose writing style drowned the reader in unnecessary words.
meanings.sent5: The verbose speaker bored the audience with his long-winded speech.

meanings.sent1: The verbose essay was difficult to read due to its excessive length.

meanings.sent3: The verbose clock ticked loudly, as if it enjoyed hearing itself.
meanings.sent4: The verbose clouds filled the sky with unnecessary fluff.
meanings.sent5: His verbose storytelling made the listeners lose interest quickly.
